description: '''Michael Owusu Addo''' (born 10 July 1985), known professionally as '''Sarkodie''' ({{IPAc-en|s|ɑːr|ˈ|k|ɔː|d|i|ɛ}}), is a Ghanaian [[Rapping|rapper]], [[songwriter]], and [[Entrepreneurship|entrepreneur]] from [[Tema]]. He started rapping at a young age and has since become a household name in the Ghanaian and Global music industry. His contributions to the [[Ghanaian people|Ghanaian]] music industry have earned him numerous [[List of awards and nominations received by Sarkodie|accolades]], including TGMA then [[Vodafone Ghana Music Awards|Vodafone Ghana Music Award]] (VGMA) for "Artiste of the Decade". He was announced the first winner of [[BET|BET's]] Best International Flow Artist at the 2019 [[BET Hip Hop Awards]]. He is also considered one of the major proponents of the [[Azonto]] [[genre]] and dance and as the most successful African rapper of all time. Due to the variety of [[musical genres]] he can perform in, Sarkodie is referred to as a "multifaceted rapper" and frequently raps in his native language, [[Twi]].
